data.content:
verb
bathes; bathed; bathing
[no obj] chiefly US :to take a bath :to wash yourself in a bath
I always bathe [=(Brit) bath] in the morning.
[+ obj] chiefly US :to wash (someone) in a container filled with water :to give a bath to (someone)
We'll bathe [=(Brit) bath] the baby after she eats.
[no obj] somewhat old-fashioned :to swim for pleasure
We bathed [=swam] in the ocean. - see also sunbathe
[+ obj] :to wash or rinse (a part of the body)
If the chemical comes in contact with the eyes, bathe the eyes with water for 10 minutes.
[+ obj] :to cover (an area or surface) with light
The moon bathed the town in light. = The town was bathed in moonlight.
bathed in sweat
covered with sweat :very sweaty
He was bathed in sweat when he finished exercising.
noun
plural bathes
[count] Brit :the act of swimming for pleasure :swim
We went for a bathe in the sea.

Tính từ
[ướt] đẫm, đầm đìa
face bathed in tears
mặt đầm đìa nước mắt
after the match, I was bathed with sweat
sau trận đấu tôi ướt đẫm mồ hôi
